conclusion: Analyze the given graph and use Newton's second law of motion.
Graph shows relationship between acceleration a and force F.
Equation of the line is a = F/m, where m is total mass of system.
Slope of the line is the coefficient of proportionality between force and acceleration.
Slope is calculated as 7.5 N/m, which equals total mass m.
Total mass m is calculated as 7.5 kg.
Force F is used to overcome friction and accelerate the system.
Frictional force f is given by f = μN, where μ is coefficient of kinetic friction and N is normal force.
Normal force N is equal to weight of the system, N = mg = 75 N.
Frictional force is f = μ × 75 N.
Net force acting on the system is F - f = ma.
Substitute f = μ × 75 N and a = F/7.5 kg into the equation.
Equation simplifies to -μ × 75 N = 0, which is not possible.
Intercept of the graph is force at which acceleration starts, F = 12 N.
Static friction f_s is given by f_s = μ_s × 75 N.
Net force required to start motion is F = f_s, so 12 N = μ_s × 75 N.
Coefficient of kinetic friction is not directly given by the graph.
